levelledPara.title: GENERAL SAFETY

warning.warningAndCautionPara: LIQUID HYDROGEN IS EXTREMELY HAZARDOUS. Temperature: -253°C (-423°F). Contact causes instant severe frostbite and hypothermia. Hydrogen gas is odorless, colorless, and highly flammable. Explosion risk in concentrations of 4-75% in air. Lower Explosive Limit (LEL) = 4%.

levelledPara.para: All personnel working on H2 refueling systems must:

listItem.para: Be certified for H2 systems maintenance (certification code: H2-CERT-01)
Complete annual refresher training
Understand emergency procedures
Never work alone on pressurized systems

levelledPara.title: PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE)
levelledPara.para: The following PPE is MANDATORY when working on H2 systems:

listItem.para: Cryogenic gloves - Elbow-length, loose-fitting for quick removal. Rated for -253°C.
Face shield - Full-face protection rated for cryogenic service.
Safety glasses - Must be worn under face shield.
Cryogenic apron - Insulated, liquid-repellent material.
Safety boots - Steel toe, slip-resistant, high-top to prevent liquid entry.
Long pants - Must cover top of boots. NO cuffs (can trap liquid).

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Do NOT wear rings, watches, or jewelry. Metal jewelry can freeze to skin instantly on contact with cryogenic liquid. Remove before work.

levelledPara.title: AREA SAFETY REQUIREMENTS
levelledPara.para: Before any H2 refueling maintenance work:

listItem.para: Establish 50-meter (164-foot) safety zone around aircraft
Post warning signs: "HYDROGEN FUEL - NO SMOKING - NO OPEN FLAMES"
Remove all ignition sources within safety zone
Verify forced ventilation is operational (50 ACH minimum)
Position fire extinguishers (Class D, dry powder) every 15 meters
Ensure emergency shower and eyewash station available within 10 meters
Verify H2 gas detectors are operational and calibrated
Confirm communication system with control center is functional

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Static electricity can ignite hydrogen vapor. ALL equipment and aircraft must be properly grounded before starting any H2 fuel system work.

listItem.para: Connect grounding cable to aircraft grounding point
Verify resistance ≤3 milliohm using calibrated meter
Maintain grounding throughout entire work period
Verify ground connection integrity every 30 minutes
Do NOT disconnect ground until all H2 work is complete

levelledPara.title: SYSTEM DEPRESSURIZATION
levelledPara.para: Before opening any H2 fuel system component:

listItem.para: Verify tanks are completely defueled
Purge all lines with nitrogen (min 5 volume exchanges)
Verify pressure is zero on all gauges
Test atmosphere with calibrated H2 detector (must read 0 ppm)
Lock out/tag out all fuel system valves
Install safety plugs/caps on opened lines

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Wait minimum 30 minutes after depressurization before opening system. Cryogenic components need time to warm above condensation temperature to prevent ice formation and atmospheric oxygen condensation.

levelledPara.title: LEAK DETECTION AND TESTING
levelledPara.para: When performing leak tests or pressure tests:

listItem.para: Use ONLY nitrogen gas for pressure testing (NEVER use air or oxygen)
Increase pressure gradually (max 0.5 bar per minute)
Use approved leak detection solution (soap-based, H2-compatible)
For helium leak testing, use calibrated mass spectrometer
Release pressure slowly to prevent seal damage
Maintain continuous H2 gas monitoring during all tests
IMMEDIATELY activate emergency shutoff
Evacuate personnel to upwind location outside safety zone
Alert fire department and emergency response team
Do NOT re-enter until H2 concentration <1% (below LEL/4)
Increase ventilation to maximum
Remove affected person from hazard area
Do NOT remove frozen clothing (will tear skin)
Flush affected area with LUKEWARM water (never hot)
Do NOT rub or massage frozen tissue
Seek immediate medical attention
Continue warm water flush until medical help arrives

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Hydrogen flames are nearly INVISIBLE in daylight. Assume fire is present if heat is detected. Do NOT attempt to approach until fire is confirmed out.

listItem.para: Activate emergency alarm
Evacuate all personnel
Alert fire department
If safe to do so, close fuel source valves
Let fire burn unless endangering personnel or property
Use water spray to cool adjacent structures

levelledPara.title: PROHIBITED ACTIONS
levelledPara.para: The following actions are STRICTLY PROHIBITED:

listItem.para: Working on pressurized H2 systems
Smoking within 100 meters of H2 fuel systems
Using cellular phones during refueling operations
Using non-intrinsically-safe tools near H2 systems
Performing "hot work" (welding, grinding) without special permit
Operating vehicles with internal combustion engines in safety zone
Overriding safety interlocks or alarms
Working alone on H2 systems

levelledPara.title: REGULATORY COMPLIANCE
levelledPara.para: All H2 refueling maintenance must comply with:

listItem.para: EASA CS-25 Certification Specifications
FAA AC 20-XXX (Hydrogen Fuel Systems)
ISO 14687:2019 (Hydrogen fuel quality)
SAE AIR6464 (Hydrogen propulsion systems)
NFPA 2 (Hydrogen Technologies Code)
Local authority safety regulations
